bug.summary: set_device error for non-integer CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES environment
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
My cluster does not set CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES is a list of integers, instead it is a list of hashes. Therefore my code crashes on this line <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/master/pytorch_lightning/trainer/distrib_data_parallel.py#L509>https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/master/pytorch_lightning/trainer/distrib_data_parallel.py#L509</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Can be reproduced by setting CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES to a list non-integers. <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Shouldn't local_rank already be a number between [0, num_gpus-1]? Is there a reason to actually choose from this list of devices (use case I'm not aware of)? Maybe just set local_rank = global_rank % num_gpus? <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
